Source: PARO 2024-25 Collective Agreement (Ontario PGY1 rate $63,292); PARA 2024-25 salary schedule (Alberta PGY1 ~$63,685); Resident Doctors of BC 2024-25 agreement (BC PGY1 ~$60,936); FMRQ 2024-25 salary schedule (Quebec PGY1 ~$53,804 + supplements); Resident Doctors of Saskatchewan 2024-25 agreement
Notes: Min=lowest province (Quebec base ~$53,804 but with on-call/weekend supplements reaches ~$60,000+; BC at ~$60,936 used as effective floor); Typical=Ontario PARO PGY1 rate ($63,292 for 2024-25 agreement year); Max=Alberta PARA PGY1 ($63,685) or provinces with northern/rural premiums reaching ~$68,000. All provinces have standardized single-rate pay for each PGY year — no range within a given province/year. Figures are base salary only — exclude call stipends ($100-200/shift), moonlighting income, and professional development allowances ($1,000-2,500/yr). Residents receive benefits (health/dental) through provincial associations. Annual hours worked typically 50-60 hrs/week. Quebec figures are notably lower in base salary but supplemented differently.

Source: PARO 2024-25 Collective Agreement (Ontario PGY2 $66,897 / PGY3 $73,168); PARA 2024-25 salary schedule (Alberta PGY2 ~$68,614 / PGY3 ~$74,935); Resident Doctors of BC 2024-25 agreement (BC PGY2 ~$66,096 / PGY3 ~$73,500); FMRQ 2024-25 salary schedule (Quebec rates + supplements)
Notes: Min=PGY2 in a lower-paying province (BC PGY2 ~$66,096; Quebec base PGY2 lower but supplemented to ~$63,000+; $63,000 used as floor); Typical=midpoint of PGY2-PGY3 range in Ontario (~$70,000, between PARO PGY2 $66,897 and PGY3 $73,168); Max=PGY3 in Alberta (~$74,935) or with rural/northern top-ups reaching ~$78,000. Salary increments are ~$3,000-5,000 per PGY year in most provinces. Ontario PARO increments: PGY1→PGY2 ~$3,605; PGY2→PGY3 ~$6,271. Same exclusions as PGY1 — call stipends, moonlighting, and professional development allowances are additional. Some PGY3 residents in surgical programs begin significant call duties with corresponding stipend income.

Source: PARO 2024-25 Collective Agreement (Ontario PGY4 $76,625 / PGY5 $82,061 / PGY6 $86,124 / PGY7 $88,521); PARA 2024-25 salary schedule (Alberta PGY4 ~$78,000 / PGY5 ~$82,500 / PGY6+ ~$87,000); CaRMS fellowship salary data; Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada fellowship program compensation data
Notes: Fellows and senior residents in Canada are PGY4-PGY7+ depending on specialty. Min=PGY4 in a lower-paying province (~$73,000); Typical=PGY5 in Ontario ($82,061) or Alberta (~$82,500), representing mid-fellowship for most specialties; Max=PGY7+ in highest-paying province (~$88,521 in Ontario) or with clinical fellowships that offer enhanced stipends reaching ~$95,000. Some subspecialty clinical fellowships (e.g., cardiac surgery PGY7-8) or research fellowships at major centres offer top-up stipends of $5,000-15,000. Surgical specialties (ortho, neuro, cardiac) typically train to PGY6-7. Provincial pay scales top out at PGY7 or PGY8. Same exclusions apply — call stipends, moonlighting (which becomes more lucrative at senior levels), and professional development allowances are additional.

Source: CMA Physician Compensation Survey 2023-24; CIHI National Physician Database 2022-23 (latest published); Ontario AFP/AFA salaried physician pay ranges; Alberta ARP (Academic/Alternative Relationship Plan) physician compensation; BC Physicians Services Committee salaried models; provincial health authority job postings (Nova Scotia Health, Saskatchewan Health Authority, etc.) Feb 2026
Notes: ESTIMATED. Salaried staff physician positions in Canada exist primarily through Alternative Funding Plans (AFPs) in academic centres and provincial salary models (e.g., Ontario AFP, Alberta ARP, BC salaried models, Maritime provinces). Min=$200,000 reflects entry-level family medicine/general practice or lower-paying specialties (public health, psychiatry) in salaried academic positions; Typical=$280,000 reflects mid-career salaried specialist in an academic centre or family physician in a well-compensated provincial model; Max=$350,000 reflects senior salaried specialist in high-demand specialty or with administrative/leadership premium. CIHI 2022-23 data: average gross clinical payment per physician $380,000 (all payment models combined, before overhead). Salaried physicians typically earn less gross than fee-for-service but have zero overhead costs, receive employer-paid benefits (health/dental/CMPA in some provinces), pension contributions (HOOPP in Ontario ~$20-30k/yr employer match), paid vacation (4-6 weeks), and CME allowances ($2,000-5,000/yr). Varies enormously by specialty and province.

Source: CIHI National Physician Database 2022-23 (gross fee-for-service billings by specialty); CMA Physician Compensation Survey 2023-24; Ontario Health Insurance Plan (OHIP) fee schedule; Alberta Health Services physician billing data; provincial medical association fee guides; Scott's Medical Database physician income reports
Notes: ESTIMATED. Fee-for-service (FFS) is the dominant payment model in Canada — approximately 70% of physician payments. Enormous variation by specialty. Min=$250,000 reflects family medicine gross billings in lower-billing provinces or early-career (CIHI 2022-23 average FM gross billings ~$340,000); Typical=$350,000 reflects mid-career family physician or lower-billing specialist gross billings (CIHI overall average gross clinical payment ~$380,000 in 2022-23); Max=$600,000+ reflects high-billing procedural/surgical specialties (ophthalmology avg ~$790k, cardiac surgery ~$670k, radiology ~$570k, orthopaedics ~$540k gross per CIHI 2022-23). CRITICAL: FFS figures are GROSS billings before overhead. Overhead costs (clinic rent, staff, equipment, supplies, insurance, billing) typically consume 25-40% of gross for office-based practices (family medicine ~30%, surgical ~20%, radiology ~35-40%). Net income after overhead is substantially lower. CMPA fees ($3,000-$60,000+/yr by specialty) are additional. No employer pension — physicians must fund own retirement. Physicians pay both employee and employer CPP contributions (self-employed rate). Provincial billing numbers required to practice FFS.
